eu.opends.analyzer

Class DeviationComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.opends.analyzer.DeviationComputer

  • public class DeviationComputer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class computes the deviation of a car's driven track from a given ideal line. Both (track and ideal line) are considered as set of two-dimensional points.
    Author:
    Rafael Math

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeviationComputer(float roadWidth)
      Creates a new deviation computer and sets the width of the road, i.e. a way point's maximum distance from the ideal line to be taken into account (road width = 1/2 distance) and the distance of the way point line from ground

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addIdealPoint(com.jme3.math.Vector2f currentIdealPoint)
      Adds an ideal point to the list.
      void addIdealPointToPreprocessor(java.lang.String name, com.jme3.math.Vector2f currentIdealPoint)
      Adds an ideal point to the preprocessor list.
      void addWayPoint(com.jme3.math.Vector3f point)
      Adds a way point to the list.
      float getDeviation()
      This method returns the area between ideal line and driven line by splitting up the inner region into quadrangles and triangles.
      java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getDeviationPoints()
      Returns the list of deviation points, i.e. ideal point / way point pairs used to draw diagonal lines between ideal and driven line.
      java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getIdealPoints()
      Returns the list of all given ideal points as 3-dimensional vectors (adding height to internal 2-dimensional representation)
      float getLengthOfIdealLine()
      Computes the length of the given ideal line by adding the distances between all neighbored ideal point pairs.
      java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getWayPoints()
      Returns the list of all given way points as 3-dimensional vectors
      void log(java.lang.String message)
      Writes messages to the console if flag DEBUGMODE is set to true.
      void processIdealPoints()
      Copies the sorted ideal points to the ideal points list.
      void showAllIdealPoints()
      Writes all given ideal points to the console
      void showAllWayPoints()
      Writes all given way points to the console

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviationComputer

        public DeviationComputer(float roadWidth)
        Creates a new deviation computer and sets the width of the road, i.e. a way point's maximum distance from the ideal line to be taken into account (road width = 1/2 distance) and the distance of the way point line from ground
        Parameters:
        roadWidth - Maximum distance of way points to be considered (road width = 1/2 distance)

    • Method Detail

      • addIdealPointToPreprocessor

        public void addIdealPointToPreprocessor(java.lang.String name,
                               com.jme3.math.Vector2f currentIdealPoint)
        Adds an ideal point to the preprocessor list. By calling processIdealPoints(), this sorted list will be added to the ideal point list. Used to sort ideal points by their name.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the ideal point (for sorting).
        currentIdealPoint - Ideal point's coordinates

      • processIdealPoints

        public void processIdealPoints()
        Copies the sorted ideal points to the ideal points list.

      • addIdealPoint

        public void addIdealPoint(com.jme3.math.Vector2f currentIdealPoint)
        Adds an ideal point to the list. Order is significant for computation. If distance to previous ideal point is too large, further ideal points will be added in between. This allows a better approximation of the deviation and its visualization.
        Parameters:
        currentIdealPoint - ideal point

      • showAllIdealPoints

        public void showAllIdealPoints()
        Writes all given ideal points to the console

      • getIdealPoints

        public java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getIdealPoints()
        Returns the list of all given ideal points as 3-dimensional vectors (adding height to internal 2-dimensional representation)
        Returns:
        list of ideal points

      • getLengthOfIdealLine

        public float getLengthOfIdealLine()
        Computes the length of the given ideal line by adding the distances between all neighbored ideal point pairs.
        Returns:
        distance from first to last ideal point passing all intermediate ideal points

      • addWayPoint

        public void addWayPoint(com.jme3.math.Vector3f point)
        Adds a way point to the list. Order is significant for computation.
        Parameters:
        point - way point

      • showAllWayPoints

        public void showAllWayPoints()
        Writes all given way points to the console

      • getWayPoints

        public java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getWayPoints()
        Returns the list of all given way points as 3-dimensional vectors
        Returns:
        list of way points

      • getDeviationPoints

        public java.util.List<com.jme3.math.Vector3f> getDeviationPoints()
        Returns the list of deviation points, i.e. ideal point / way point pairs used to draw diagonal lines between ideal and driven line.
        Returns:
        list of points, outlining the diagonal line

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.String message)
        Writes messages to the console if flag DEBUGMODE is set to true.
        Parameters:
        message - message to write to console

      • getDeviation

        public float getDeviation()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns the area between ideal line and driven line by splitting up the inner region into quadrangles and triangles.
        Returns:
        Area between ideal line and driven line
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If less than 3 ideal points are given.
